narrative_raw: Over the past two weeks, this person has never had little interest or pleasure in doing things. This person has felt down, depressed, or hopeless more than half the days. This person has had trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much more than half the days. This person has never felt tired or having little energy. This person has never had poor appetite or overeaten. This person has never felt bad about themselves — or that this person is a failure or has let themselves or their family down. This person has never had trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television. This person has never moved or spoken so slowly that other people could have noticed. This person has never had thoughts that this person would be better off dead or of hurting themselves in some way.
narrative_paraphrased: Over the past two weeks, this person has found themselves grappling with a persistent lack of interest or pleasure in activities that once held their attention. More than half of these days have been overshadowed by feelings of being down, depressed, or hopeless, casting a lingering shadow that they struggle to shake. Nights have been particularly challenging, with this person battling either to fall asleep or to remain asleep, only to find themselves sleeping too much when they do finally manage to rest. Strikingly, however, this person has not suffered from fatigue or felt drained of energy.  Throughout this difficult period, appetite has remained steady, neither waning nor driving this person to overeat. Rather unexpectedly, this person has maintained a neutral self-view, not burdened by feelings of failure or self-reproach, nor carrying the weight of letting themselves or their family down. Concentration has also remained sharp, allowing this person to engage with reading or watching television without struggle. In their interactions, this person has moved and spoken at a normal pace, avoiding drawing any unwanted attention from others.  Encouragingly, despite the emotional turmoil, this person has never succumbed to thoughts of self-harm or considered the world better off without them. Even amidst the gloom, this person holds onto a sense of resilience, determined to navigate through this tough time without spiraling into deeper despair.

narrative_paraphrased: Over the past two weeks, this person has found life to be increasingly difficult. With little interest or pleasure in activities that once brought joy, the days have blurred together in a haze. More than half of these days have been marked by feelings of being down, depressed, or hopeless, casting a shadow over daily life.  Trouble with sleep has been a constant companion for this person, with nights spent either tossing and turning or succumbing to long, restless slumbers on many occasions. Paradoxically, despite the sleep disturbances, this person has managed to maintain energy levels throughout.  Eating patterns have been erratic; on some days, food seems unappealing, while on others, meals become a source of comfort in their abundance. This fluctuation has added to an underlying sense of unease. Nearly every day, this person has wrestled with feelings of self-doubt and inadequacy, plagued by the thought of being a failure or disappointing loved ones.  Concentration has been elusive, as this person has repeatedly struggled to focus on reading the newspaper or following television shows, tasks that once required no effort. Despite the internal turmoil, this person has managed to retain a semblance of normalcy in outward behavior, with no noticeable slowing in movement or speech.  Importantly, thoughts of self-harm or ending it all have never been an issue, providing a thin thread of reassurance amid the pervasive gloom. In navigating these challenging weeks, this person moves through each day with quiet determination, facing the struggles head-on, hoping for a glimmer of clarity or relief on the horizon.

narrative_paraphrased: Over the past two weeks, this person has been trudging through days marked by an overwhelming sense of apathy and gloom. Each sunrise offers little motivation, as the usual activities that once sparked interest now feel burdensome and hollow. More often than not, an oppressive cloud of sadness and hopelessness lingers, wrapping this person in its embrace and refusing to let go.   As night falls, the struggle continues. Sleep, which should offer respite, becomes a battle in itself – whether in the form of restless nights, marked by tossing and turning, or the unshakeable heaviness of oversleeping. Despite the abundance of rest or lack thereof, this person finds energy elusive, with fatigue settling in like a constant companion.   Some days come with an additional burden—the burden of self-doubt and guilt. On those days, the weight of past actions and perceived failures feels crushing, as if this person has disappointed not only themselves but also those around them.   Tasks that necessitate focus become daunting challenges, as concentration ebbs and flows like an unreliable tide. The simple joy of reading a newspaper or following a television show fades, leaving in its place a frustrating haze. With time, even the pace of movement and speech becomes an unwitting reflection of the internal struggle, slowing to a point where the change is perhaps apparent to others.         Yet amidst this emotional and mental turbulence, one constant remains: this person has never entertained the thought of self-harm or escaping life entirely. There is a resilience, however faint, that persists—a quiet conviction that, despite the heavy shadows of the past fortnight, there is still a glimmer of hope worth holding onto.

The usual pleasures that once brought joy and excitement have lost their luster, leaving a vast emptiness in their wake. Each morning this person wakes from a sleep that is either fitful or excessive, yet neither brings the energy that is desperately needed. Despite knowing their worth, an inner voice whispers cruel reminders of failure and inadequacy nearly every day. In the quiet moments, this person's movements seem sluggish, the weight of the world translating into every step and word. It's as if time has slowed around them, yet the world continues its hurried pace, noticing the stark difference. On several days, darker thoughts have surfaced, unbidden and unwelcome, hinting at the notion that perhaps life would be easier if they no longer had to face it.  Yet through this haze, a quiet strength remains, an ember of hope that seeks to reignite. Though the past two weeks have been fraught with challenges, each day holds the potential for change, for light to pierce through the darkness and guide this person to brighter days ahead.

Amidst this storm of emotions, distressing thoughts have crept in on several days, contemplating that perhaps this person might be better off not facing the relentless burden each day brings. Through all of this, reaching out for help could be one of the few remaining paths to finding solace and hope.

Despite everything, this person continued on, navigating each day under the weight of these overwhelming feelings, seeking a semblance of hope amidst the despair.

Despite this emotional heaviness, this person has never struggled with sleep, maintaining a consistent sleep pattern without difficulty falling asleep or oversleeping.   Interestingly, this person has maintained normal energy levels, never feeling unusually tired or drained. However, food has become an inconsistent comfort, with days marked by either a poor appetite or bouts of overeating, reflecting a tumultuous inner state.  This person has frequently felt plagued by self-doubt, often considering themselves a failure or believing they have let down their family. Concentration has been a nearly impossible feat, with even straightforward tasks like reading the newspaper or watching television requiring tremendous effort and focus.  On more than half the days, this person's movements and speech have slowed noticeably, perhaps significant enough for others to perceive the change. Despite the mental and emotional challenges faced, thoughts of self-harm or the belief that the world would be better without this person have never surfaced.

This person has had poor appetite or overeaten more than half the days. narrative_paraphrased: Over the past two weeks, this person has been struggling with an overwhelming sense of despondency. More than half the days, this person finds no interest or pleasure in activities that once brought joy. Almost every day, an oppressive weight of feeling down, depressed, or utterly hopeless clings to this person, casting a shadow over all aspects of life.  Sleep eludes this person as well, with nights spent tossing and turning or, at times, oversleeping in an attempt to escape the relentless fatigue. This person wakes feeling more drained than rested. It seems that more than half the days, energy is a scarce resource, leaving this person weary and worn.  Food, too, has lost its normal rhythm. This person swings between a lack of appetite and moments of overeating, each extreme troubling more than half the days. Each reflection in the mirror only deepens the conviction that this person is a failure, letting down themselves and, perhaps more painfully, their family. Nearly every day, self-reproach and guilt loop relentlessly in this person's mind.  Concentration has become almost impossible for this person. Once simple tasks, like reading the newspaper or watching television, often slip beyond reach as focus fractures time and again. Though this person has never moved or spoken so slowly that it would draw others' attention, the drag of despair is painfully evident within.  Several days have been particularly dark, with thoughts creeping in that this person might be better off dead or thoughts of self-harm disturbing the fragile peace. Despite these silent struggles, this person carries on, living through each day with the hope for a glimmer of change or relief.

Sleep offers no solace, as restless nights blur into days filled with fatigue. Each morning this person wakes from a sleep that is either fitful or excessive, yet neither brings the energy that is desperately needed. Appetite, too, has become unpredictable; some days food is an afterthought, while others it becomes a refuge from the gnawing emptiness.  Despite knowing their worth, an inner voice whispers cruel reminders of failure and inadequacy nearly every day. Everyday tasks, simple activities like reading a newspaper or following a television program, demand a concentration that feels unattainable.  In the quiet moments, this person's movements seem sluggish, the weight of the world translating into every step and word. It's as if time has slowed around them, yet the world continues its hurried pace, noticing the stark difference. On several days, darker thoughts have surfaced, unbidden and unwelcome, hinting at the notion that perhaps life would be easier if they no longer had to face it.  Yet through this haze, a quiet strength remains, an ember of hope that seeks to reignite. Though the past two weeks have been fraught with challenges, each day holds the potential for change, for light to pierce through the darkness and guide this person to brighter days ahead.

This person has had poor appetite or overeaten more than half the days. This person has felt bad about themselves — or that this person is a failure or has let themselves or their family down more than half the days. This person has had thoughts that this person would be better off dead or of hurting themselves in some way nearly every day.
narrative_paraphrased: Over the past two weeks, this person has wandered through the days in a fog of disinterest, where activities that once brought joy now seem gray and distant. Nearly every day, this person struggles to summon enthusiasm, each hour weighed down by a persistent sense of hopelessness. Sleep, once a refuge, has become a challenge—either eluding this person entirely or stretching on endlessly. Fatigue has wrapped itself around this person's shoulders more than half the days, sapping any semblance of energy and leaving this person feeling perpetually exhausted.  Eating habits have followed a similar chaotic pattern, with a pendulum swinging between poor appetite and overeating, more days than not. Feelings of inadequacy and self-criticism echo in this person's mind, often convincing this person that personal failures have let down not only themselves but also their family. Concentration has become a formidable opponent, breaking this person's focus on tasks as simple as reading the newspaper or watching television.   Nearly every day, this person's movements have slowed, a languid pace that others could hardly ignore. Lingering thoughts, dark and foreboding, have crept into this person's mind: thoughts that suggest a world in which this person no longer exists. Yet, quietly enduring, this person hopes for a glimmer of light through the pervasive shadows.

narrative_paraphrased: Over the past two weeks, this person has been trudging through days marked by an overwhelming sense of apathy and gloom. Each sunrise offers little motivation, as the usual activities that once sparked interest now feel burdensome and hollow. More often than not, an oppressive cloud of sadness and hopelessness lingers, wrapping this person in its embrace and refusing to let go.   As night falls, the struggle continues. Sleep, which should offer respite, becomes a battle in itself – whether in the form of restless nights, marked by tossing and turning, or the unshakeable heaviness of oversleeping. Despite the abundance of rest or lack thereof, this person finds energy elusive, with fatigue settling in like a constant companion.   Some days come with an additional burden—the burden of self-doubt and guilt. On those days, the weight of past actions and perceived failures feels crushing, as if this person has disappointed not only themselves but also those around them.   Tasks that necessitate focus become daunting challenges, as concentration ebbs and flows like an unreliable tide. The simple joy of reading a newspaper or following a television show fades, leaving in its place a frustrating haze. With time, even the pace of movement and speech becomes an unwitting reflection of the internal struggle, slowing to a point where the change is perhaps apparent to others.         Yet amidst this emotional and mental turbulence, one constant remains: this person has never entertained the thought of self-harm or escaping life entirely. There is a resilience, however faint, that persists—a quiet conviction that, despite the heavy shadows of the past fortnight, there is still a glimmer of hope worth holding onto.

Despite everything, this person continued on, navigating each day under the weight of these overwhelming feelings, seeking a semblance of hope amidst the despair.

Concentration falters, making focusing on simple tasks like reading the newspaper or watching television a daunting challenge on more than half the days. The changes in her are not just internal. Movements and speech are often so lethargic and slow that those around may notice nearly every day. In the darkest moments, thoughts of self-harm or the belief that the world might be better off without her have surfaced with alarming frequency. Each day has been a struggle, navigating a terrain filled with emotional and physical hurdles.

narrative_paraphrased: Over the past two weeks, this person has navigated a landscape engulfed in shadow, where the vibrant hues of daily life have lost their brilliance. Each morning, this person awoke to a world steeped in gray, the thought of engaging with the day ahead devoid of allure or joy. The feeling of despondency settled in like an unwelcome guest, whispering a litany of hopelessness that echoed in the corners of the mind nearly every day.  The nights offered little respite, as sleep became a capricious companion. This person lay awake, thoughts swirling, drifting into slumber only to awaken too soon, or sometimes retreating into sleep's embrace for far longer than intended. Fatigue clung to this person, a constant reminder of the energy that once fueled passions and pursuits now diminished to mere embers.  Eating became either a neglected necessity or an overzealous escape, as the appetite betrayed its natural rhythm. Guilt and self-reproach carved deep furrows in the heart, each day burdened by the heavy cloak of perceived failure, convinced that family and personal expectations lay shattered at their feet. Concentration eluded this person, words on a page or scenes on a screen fading into an indistinct blur of disinterest.  Movements and words slowed as if submerged in a viscous malaise, drawing curious glances or worried inquiries from those around. Yet, it was the pervasive, haunting notion—the fleeting, dangerous belief that all might be simpler without existence—that loomed most ominously. More than once, this person contemplated the comfort of silence over the cacophony of despair, the shadow of such thoughts casting a long, chilling reflection over more than half the days.

Nearly every day, this person has faced the burdensome weight of feeling down, depressed, or hopeless, which has cast a persistent shadow over daily life. Battling restlessness, this person has struggled with sleep, either finding it difficult to fall or stay asleep, or alternatively, sleeping excessively, leaving a constant shroud of fatigue. The exhaustion has seeped into the core of this person's being, causing a notable lack of energy to engage with the world.  Eating habits have also been irregular, as this person's appetite has swung from near absence to overindulgence, reflecting the inner turmoil. Despite these challenges, this person has maintained a steady belief in personal worth, never succumbing to feelings of failure or shame regarding oneself or one's family. However, concentration has been another casualty, with this person finding it hard to focus on tasks like reading the newspaper or watching television more often than not.  Movements and speech have slowed to a pace that others couldn't help but notice, marking the visible signs of this internal struggle. Most concerning, however, have been the intrusive thoughts that continuously surface, whispering that it would be better to not exist or to inflict harm upon oneself. These thoughts have lingered nearly every day, underscoring the urgent need for hope and healing in this person's life. Yet, through the haze of these emotions, an unyielding flicker of resilience remains.

narrative_raw: Over the past two weeks, this person has had little interest or pleasure in doing things several days. This person has felt down, depressed, or hopeless nearly every day. This person has had trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much more than half the days. This person has felt tired or having little energy more than half the days. This person has had poor appetite or overeaten nearly every day. This person has felt bad about themselves — or that this person is a failure or has let themselves or their family down nearly every day. This person has had trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television nearly every day. This person has never moved or spoken so slowly that other people could have noticed. This person has had thoughts that this person would be better off dead or of hurting themselves in some way nearly every day.
narrative_paraphrased: Over the past two weeks, this person has navigated through a haze of disinterest and lethargy that seemed to wrap around every corner of daily life. Gone were the days of easily finding joy in simple activities. Instead, feelings of being down and hopeless seemed to weigh heavily and relentlessly, refusing to lift. Nights became battlegrounds, where this person wrestled with the elusive nature of sleep. When sleep did come, it either felt like too little or too much.  Throughout many days, this person struggled with a pervasive tiredness that seemed to seep into the bones, making simple tasks feel monumental. Meals were no refuge; appetite was as inconsistent as the mood, swinging from barely touching food to mindlessly overeating. Each day felt like a fresh inventory of self-doubt, where this person grappled with feelings of inadequacy and failure that stemmed from within and reached into family expectations.  Concentration became a rare visitor, slipping away when attempting to read a newspaper or follow a storyline on television. Though outwardly, this person never moved or spoke in a slowed manner that others might notice, internally, the heaviness impacted every thought and action. The darkest of moments brought uninvited, troubling thoughts of self-harm, casting a shadow over nearly every attempt to find some semblance of peace.  In this bleak landscape, this person stood, quietly hoping for a turning point, a moment where light would break through the pervasive gloom and lead toward healing.
